meanings.definition: Penetrating, cutting, or biting, as in a sharp incisive tone.
meanings.sent1: Her incisive remarks left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent2: The professor gave an incisive lecture on the topic.
meanings.sent3: His incisive wit could always lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: The incisive criticism made him rethink his approach.
meanings.sent5: The incisive blade sliced through the tough material effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Clear and direct in expression, as in an incisive analysis.
meanings.sent1: The incisive report highlighted the key findings.
meanings.sent2: She had an incisive way of getting to the point.
meanings.sent3: The incisive explanation made everything crystal clear.
meanings.sent4: His incisive writing style captivated the readers.
meanings.sent5: The incisive details painted a vivid picture of the scene.

meanings.definition: Having or showing keen insight, as in an incisive mind.
meanings.sent1: Her incisive observations were always on point.
meanings.sent2: He possessed an incisive understanding of human behavior.
meanings.sent3: The incisive detective quickly solved the case.
meanings.sent4: His incisive intuition guided him through tough decisions.
meanings.sent5: The incisive analysis revealed hidden patterns in the data.
